title: Proability of Events with Equally Likely Outcomes
text: The probability of an event $$E$$ in an experiment with sample space $$S$$ with equally likely outcomes is given by: $$P(E)=$$ (# of elements in E)/(# of elements in S)
speech: The probability of an event E in an experiment with sample space S with equally likely outcomes is given by: P(E)  is equal to  (# of elements in E)/(# of elements in S)
math: (# of elements in E)/(# of elements in S)
pacedSpeech: The probability of an event E
in an experiment with sample space S
with equally likely outcomes is given by: p of e  is equal to
number of elements in E over number of elements in S
